item.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S6305-6306; text as passed Senate: CR S6305-6306)
Passed/agreed to in Senate: Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.(consideration: CR S6305-6306; text as passed Senate: CR S6305-6306)
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 225 - 197 (Roll no. 445). (text: CR H5949)
Passed/agreed to in House: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 225 - 197 (Roll no. 445).(text: CR H5949)
Considered as unfinished business. (consideration: CR H5962-5963)

POSTPONED PROCEEDINGS - The Chair put the question on the adoption of the concurrent resolution and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. McKeon demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings on the question of adoption of the concurrent resolution until a time to be announced.
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H5949)

summary.text:
Declares that, when the House adjourns on the legislative day of Thursday, June 26, 2008, or Friday, June 27, 2008, it stand adjourned until 2 p.m. on Tuesday, July 8, 2008.

Declares that, when the Senate recesses or adjourns on any day from Thursday, June 26, 2008, through Friday, July 4, 2008, it stand recessed or adjourned until noon on Monday, July 7, 2008.

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Declares that, when the House adjourns on the legislative day of Thursday, June 26, 2008, or Friday, June 27, 2008, it stand adjourned until 2 p.m. on Tuesday, July 8, 2008.

Declares that, when the Senate recesses or adjourns on any day from Thursday, June 26, 2008, through Friday, July 4, 2008, it stand recessed or adjourned until noon on Monday, July 7, 2008.

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Declares that, when the House adjourns on the legislative day of Thursday, June 26, 2008, or Friday, June 27, 2008, it stand adjourned until 2 p.m. on Tuesday, July 8, 2008.

Declares that, when the Senate recesses or adjourns on any day from Thursday, June 26, 2008, through Friday, July 4, 2008, it stand recessed or adjourned until noon on Monday, July 7, 2008.

bill.title: Providing for an adjournment or recess of the two Houses.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
